title: Installation issue: WRF
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->

#### Error 1

```console
$ spack install wrf
[...]
==> wrf: Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: TypeError: int() can't convert non-string with explicit base

/home/chris/Documents/shared_projects/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/wrf/package.py:292, in run_compile_script:
        289        csh = Executable(csh_bin)
        290
        291        # num of compile jobs capped at 20 in wrf
  >>    292        num_jobs = str(min(int(make_jobs, 10)))
        293
        294        # Now run the compile script and track the output to check for
        295        # failure/success We need to do this because upstream use `make -i -k`

See build log for details:
[...]
```

#### Error 2

```
==========================================================================
build started:   Mon Dec 28 16:18:26 CET 2020
build completed: Mon Dec 28 16:29:26 CET 2020

--->                  Executables successfully built                  <---

-rwxr-xr-x 1 hd_eq192 hd_hd 45736584 Dec 28 16:29 main/ndown.exe
-rwxr-xr-x 1 hd_eq192 hd_hd 45576712 Dec 28 16:29 main/real.exe
-rwxr-xr-x 1 hd_eq192 hd_hd 44987304 Dec 28 16:29 main/tc.exe
-rwxr-xr-x 1 hd_eq192 hd_hd 51173080 Dec 28 16:28 main/wrf.exe

==========================================================================

==> Error: TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

/beegfs/home/myname/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/wrf/package.py:305, in run_compile_script:
        302            self.spec.variants["compile_type"].value,
        303        )
        304
  >>    305        if "Executables successfully built" in result_buf:
        306            return True
        307
        308        return False
```

### Possible Fixes

#### Error 1

I noticed that the error was most likely caused by 42008e532f28c41d8e134052e1a109c65a8440f9 in this changeset:
```diff
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/wrf/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/wrf/package.py
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/wrf/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/wrf/package.py
@@ -138,5 +287,6 @@
-    def build(self, spec, prefix):
-        csh = which('csh')
+    def run_compile_script(self):
+        csh_bin = self.spec["tcsh"].prefix.bin.csh
+        csh = Executable(csh_bin)
+
         # num of compile jobs capped at 20 in wrf
-        csh('./compile', '-j', str(min(int(make_jobs), 20)),
-            spec.variants['compile_type'].value)
+        num_jobs = str(min(int(make_jobs, 10)))

```
The comment notes that the build should have a maximum of 20 build jobs, is that or 10 correct?
I think there just is an error in the parentheses, see https://github.com/christian-heusel/spack/commit/8c35486037dfbe1b25e9e779c377dddc02f1d3f9

#### Error 2

I am still investigating this and will post updates if I find anything 😊 

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
* **Spack:** 0.16.0
* **Python:** 3.9.1
* **Platform:** linux-debianunstable-zen2

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

I dont think that a build report is necessary here, feel free to correct me if it yields any useful information we do not have yet here! 😊 

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
<!-- * [spack-build-out.txt]() -->
<!-- * [spack-build-env.txt]() -->

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
@MichaelLaufer  @ptooley


### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [ ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
